{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3347714,"name":"","username":"Echoing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/echoing/{size}/222017_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T10:21:26.219Z","cooked":"

Years has our team been planning to switch to a swerve module powered by two brushless motors. We are currently using a custom swerve powered by falcon and 775 with an unswappable gear ratio, which is too old, slow and inaccurate for eg. a 5 note auto(2024 season), and since WCP recently released Kraken and their second generation swerve X while falcons are experiencing a shortage, we think it’s about time.

So, has anyone tried either kraken or the new Swerve X (flipped) yet? How’s it compared to the “old-schooled” falcons and MK4i? Below are the specific questions, please share anything you know

1 How’s the new Swerve X flipped (WCP-1499)?

WestCoast Products

Swerve X Flipped

WCP’s newest generation of the swerve drive module, designed from the ground up to utilize the powerful Kraken X60 brushless motor to improve performance and remove complexity. This new design contains less components than our previous modules for...

Price: USD 324.99

2 How’s Kraken? Is it worthwhile to switch from falcon to kraken for the drivetrain? (Dual-falcon vs Dual-kraken)

3 Any problems with the early batches of Kraken?

4 How are both models’ compatibility with falcon and kraken?

5 What gear ratio should I select for our swerve?

6 (Anything else you want to add)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T10:21:26.219Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":268,"reads":935,"readers_count":934,"score":1557.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wcproducts.com/collections/systems-structure/products/swerve-x-flipped","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Swerve X Flipped – WestCoast Products","clicks":165}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61702,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6940 Former Co-Captain and Chief Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/1","custom_user_title":"6940 Former Co-Captain and Chief Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3347835,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T16:02:17.095Z","cooked":"

We’re using the Swerve X flipped with Kraken drive motors (and Falcon steering motors, because we have a lot of them and it doesn’t make a real difference in a steering motor.) We’ve been using Swerve X’s for three years now and love them. Our current configuration uses the X3 gear ratio for super speed (22.8 fps) and with the Krakens it still has tons of power. We have had a couple of problems with the Krakens themselves, but that’s not exactly surprising with brand new motors from their first production batch. Still, the combo has given us an incredibly fast robot with the push to stand up to defense very well. The new central post, with the encoder magnet built in directly, also makes these units simpler and more robust. All in all, we’ve been very happy with them.

We have had a couple of problems with the Krakens themselves

Can you elaborate on this?

my team got swerve x flipped last year and has been running them ever since, we drive them with neos so i can’t comment much on the krakens but they work great

We’ve used the sds mark iv and love them. However, SDS has struggled to keep parts in stock, and our time budget has been significantly affected. We will be moving to swerve x’s next year.

33 switched to SwerveX this year and has been very satisfied with the product and customer support.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T18:11:31.828Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":637,"readers_count":636,"score":127.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"Nick Matthes ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25311,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3347938,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T20:04:27.060Z","cooked":"

We fried a couple of Krakens early in the season by a mis-designed motor mount that had them working against each other. That was a mistake on our part and nothing against the Krakens. But we also had one of our drive Krakens overheat badly during playoffs at our last competition, causing intermittent shut-downs that affected the ability of the robot to move. Only one of the Krakens did this, the other three were fine, with only normal heating. We’ve replaced the Kraken and had no other problems, so we’re pretty sure it was a fault in the motor of some kind.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T20:04:27.060Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":592,"readers_count":591,"score":123.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53784,"username":"Max_Morehead","name":"Max Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/7","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3347982,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T21:03:22.308Z","cooked":"

If you have appropriate current limiting this sort of thing should be almost completely eliminated.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T21:03:22.308Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":537,"readers_count":536,"score":117.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32783,"username":"Strategic","name":"Stewart Riley","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/8","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348120,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T00:31:04.970Z","cooked":"

We do have appropriate current limiting, because our programmers know what they’re doing. This was one Kraken out of four on the drive train that overheated, not the kind of thing that would happen from lack of current limits on the motors.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T00:31:04.970Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":513,"readers_count":512,"score":162.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/9","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348168,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T01:53:38.550Z","cooked":"

Losing them one at a time was exactly how I found out the default stator limits were not appropriate…

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T01:53:38.550Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":480,"readers_count":479,"score":111.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32783,"username":"Strategic","name":"Stewart Riley","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348185,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T02:11:37.075Z","cooked":"

Been running Swerve X for two seasons now. They have held up.

We’re still on the OG version. So there are a few things that have needed to be replaced that have been addressed in newer iterations.

With any swerve modlule I would make sure you do through inspections and replace bearings. But that’s for a different thread.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T02:11:55.717Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":471,"readers_count":470,"score":99.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/11","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453632,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-02T05:38:09.178Z","cooked":"

Hey guys! Our team is considering switching from Mark4 to SwerveX because the belt on Mark4 sometimes breaks. It’s been about eight months since you replied, and I’m curious to know if any of you encountered any glitches with the SwerveX modules during the season. Additionally, could you share how long it took to resolve any issues that arose?

Your feedback and suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-12-02T05:39:05.334Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":371,"readers_count":370,"score":104.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"sam liu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60033,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum "},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/12","custom_user_title":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453635,"name":"Matthew K","username":"superdude311","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/superdude311/{size}/230653_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-02T05:58:15.924Z","cooked":"
catrix:

because the belt on Mark4 sometimes breaks

how often do yall replace the belt? I believe the last time the belt wear question came up it was from a team that never replaced their belts over a whole season. I believe it’s good practice to replace things like that between build season practice and competition season, and between competition season and offseason events.

superdude311:

I believe the last time the belt wear question came up it was from a team that never replaced their belts over a whole season.

Thanks for reminding; I guess that’s why. I realized that our team never maintains the modules and expects them to be permanent.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-12-02T11:16:12.982Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":67.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"sam liu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60033,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum "},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/15","custom_user_title":"CE Student @ UWaterloo | 5516 Alum ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453715,"name":"MrBasse","username":"MrBasse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrbasse/{size}/65032_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-02T14:59:08.423Z","cooked":"

If it makes you feel better, we haven’t replaced our belts in two seasons of use (130+ matches) and they are still going strong. It’s on the list to swap before this competition season though. Maintenance is easy to overlook when things are working.

We still like our SDS modules, there isn’t anything that is screaming for a swap for us so we will stick with them until something fabulously new and shiny comes out that we can’t resist or wear and tear sets in.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-12-02T15:00:44.653Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":264,"readers_count":263,"score":132.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60033,"username":"catrix","name":"sam liu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/16","custom_user_title":"FRC #3572","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3453766,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-02T16:42:24.649Z","cooked":"

Still no problems for us, even after the off-season events, demos, etc. We even built another off-season robot using our OG Swerve X modules from our first year and they worked great too. These are non-flipped modules we used for Rapid React and had a lot of use on them (two qualifiers, state championship, worlds, and four off-season events, plus demos, etc.) and took a lot of abuse (including three falls from the traverse bar and getting whacked into the mid bar multiple times until we installed a guard) but that didn’t seem to harm them at all. Even the main bearings have been holding up fine. Honestly, you couldn’t ask for a more reliable module than this.

@MrBasse @Strategic, do you have some sort of shell that protects everything from dust? It might be that something got into our swerve and caused it to jam.

We do 3d print covers for our modules, but they are still full of carpet and other fuzz. We don’t grease heavily so a light spray with compressed air will clean the bulk off and then we use a spray lubricant to keep gears happy.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-12-02T23:30:12.860Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":53.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460704,"topic_slug":"the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i","display_username":"MrBasse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60033,"username":"catrix","name":"sam liu","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC #3572"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-swerve-x-flipped-wcp-1499-vs-the-classic-sds-mk4i/460704/19","custom_user_title":"FRC #3572","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3454153,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-03T16:42:20.220Z","cooked":"

We do pretty much the same thing as Mr. Basse’s team. We have some cover pieces on them but don’t completely enclose them. They do pick up some carpet fuzz and other dirt, but we include checking that (and cleaning it if necessary) in our pit routine. You definitely should keep the grease to the minimum necessary.
